perturbation.original_text: 5.3.1 Within thirty (30) days of the end of each calendar quarter during the Term, the Company will, and Online BVI will cause the Company to, furnish to Skype complete and accurate statements (each, a "Statement") in a form acceptable to Skype, certified to be accurate by an officer of the Company or Online BVI, as applicable, showing with reasonable detail (i) the Gross Revenue actually received and collected by the Company or Online BVI, or if applicable, any Subsidiary or other Affiliate (including, without limitation, a Subsidiary or other Affiliate of Tom Holding), licensee, distributor or reseller thereof, during the preceding calendar quarter and on a cumulative basis, (ii) the Direct Expenses incurred thereby, during the preceding calendar quarter and on a cumulative basis, and (iii) the calculation of Adjusted Net Revenue.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3.1 The Company will, and Online BVI will cause the Company to, furnish to Skype statements (each, a "Statement") within ninety (90) days of the end of each fiscal year. The statements are only required to show in reasonable detail (i) the annual Gross Revenue received and (ii) the calculation of Adjusted Net Revenue.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires quarterly statements within 30 days, while the modification requires annual statements within 90 days of the fiscal year end. This delays financial reporting and contradicts standard accounting practices and potentially legal requirements for timely financial disclosures, especially since Tom Holding is listed on NASDAQ.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (regarding timely financial disclosures for publicly traded companies)

perturbation.original_text: 5.3.2 Interest shall be payable on any amounts paid later than the date due hereunder at the prime rate as reported by the New York edition of the Wall Street Journal on the day the amount is due calculated from the date any amount is due until the date of receipt of the relevant sum by the applicable Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3.2 No interest shall be payable on any late payments.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that interest is payable on late payments. The modified text removes any obligation to pay interest on late payments, which can contradict statutory interest rates on overdue commercial debts, which are legally mandated.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Laws regarding statutory interest on commercial debts

perturbation.original_text: 5.4 Audit Rights. The Parties (including Online BVI on behalf of the Online Group) agree to maintain records (i) of all information reasonably necessary to verify all calculations to be made under Section 8.3.2, and (ii) supporting, verifying and necessary to demonstrate the calculation and collection of fees and/or revenue, as well as any deductions thereto, and payments made hereunder, including, without limitation, budgets, purchase orders, expense records, invoices, correspondence, banking and financial and other records pertaining to the determination of Gross Revenue, Direct Expenses and Adjusted Net Revenue, during the term of this Agreement and for a period of two (2) years following the expiration or termination hereof. Not more than once per calendar quarter, each Party or its independent auditor (who shall be a certified public accountant) shall have the right, on not less than fifteen (15) calendar days prior notice and not during the first twenty (20) days after the close of any fiscal quarter of the other Parties, or within sixty (60) day of the close of such Parties' respective fiscal years, to audit the books of account and records of any and all such Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.4 Audit Rights. The Parties agree to maintain records during the term of this Agreement. There shall be no audit rights granted to either party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides for audit rights with specific conditions. The modification eliminates any audit rights, which conflicts with standard business practices and could be legally problematic, especially given the revenue-sharing arrangement and international nature of the agreement. Lack of audit rights makes it difficult to verify financial statements, particularly because one of the parties, Tom Holding, is listed on the NASDAQ.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) and auditing standards.
